title: [Java] Extend UInt8 class from Number
body_html:
There is an issue right now in the Java Ops API. To enforce that in some operations the data type of an operand must be of a real-number data type, the signature of those operands only accepts generics that extends from Number.

For example, DecodePng only returns the decode image as a tensor of real numbers, so it is safe (and wanted) to declare this operation class as:

public final class DecodePng<T extends Number> extends PrimitiveOp implements Operand<T>

That works well with Java standard types but it should work also with Tensorflow real-number custom types, such as UInt8. So I added a package-private base class that implements Number (called TFNumber) that is easy to extend from our real-number custom types, UInt8 in this case.

CC: @asimshankar

For example, DecodePng only returns the decode image as a tensor of real numbers, so it is safe (and wanted) to declare this operation class as:
public final class DecodePng<T extends Number> extends PrimitiveOp implements Operand<T>

That works well with Java standard types but it should work also with Tensorflow real-number custom types, such as UInt8. So I added a package-private base class that implements Number (called TFNumber) that is easy to extend from our real-number custom types, UInt8 in this case.
CC: @asimshankar
body:
There is an issue right now in the Java Ops API. To enforce that in some operations the data type of an operand must be of a real-number data type, the signature of those operands only accepts generics that extends from `Number`.

For example, `DecodePng` only returns the decode image as a tensor of real numbers, so it is safe (and wanted) to declare this operation class as:
```
public final class DecodePng<T extends Number> extends PrimitiveOp implements Operand<T>
```

That works well with Java standard types but it should work also with Tensorflow real-number custom types, such as `UInt8`. So I added a package-private base class that implements `Number` (called `TFNumber`) that is easy to extend from our real-number custom types, `UInt8` in this case.

CC: @asimshankar
